channel.title: Live action Mortal Kombat trailer: new movie or game?
channel.description:
[url]https://kotaku.com/5558339/if-this-is-the-next-mortal-kombat-movie-sign-us-up[/url]
That's a pretty good short movie, but what do you think? New movie or new game?

item.source: Live action Mortal Kombat trailer: new movie or game?

item.title: Live action Mortal Kombat trailer: new movie or game?
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
https://www.vg247.com/2010/06/10/warner-announces-mortal-kombat-for-2011-for-ps3-360/

The newest chapter of the iconic fight franchise marks a triumphant return to the series’ mature presentation and a reinvention of its classic 2D fighting mechanic. Driven by an all new graphics engine, the fan favourite Fatality is back and presented in more gory detail than ever before.

Hmmmm…

Maxey:

Mortal Kombat needs to go back to it roots with a new 2D fighting game with hi-res digitized actor sprites but with much smoother animations and more blood than ever.

hehe

Read full topic

item.source: Live action Mortal Kombat trailer: new movie or game?

item.title: Live action Mortal Kombat trailer: new movie or game?
item.dc:creator: Bolteh
item.description:
They were planning on making a new MK movie for quite some time, really glad they started giving it a proper story rather than the early-90s-fantasy-game-so-story-didn’t-matter setting.

Not too sure about the setup to make Scorpion some sort of protagonist, but meh.

Maxey:

Also, she’s hot.

No she isn’t.

Read full topic

item.title: Live action Mortal Kombat trailer: new movie or game?
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
https://twitter.com/JeriLRyan/status/15752179609

It’s not a game trailer. Actually was made for the director to sell WB on his vision for a reimagined MK film.

Hmmm, let’s see what comes out of this.

Also, she’s hot.

item.title: Live action Mortal Kombat trailer: new movie or game?
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
Both?
At first I thought it was for a movie, but the quality of the fight scene at the end is more “big-budget game trailer” than it is “hollywood movie.”

Either way, kinda interesting. I wasn’t expecting a MK reboot.
